commenter_b: Do you know common law as well as you think you know the Bible? Courts of common law MAKE law. While Congress enacts statutes, the courts write case law. So, let's put to rest the ERROR that courts don't make law. If you don't believe me, find me the statute in your state that defines the elements of slander. The decision in Obergefell doesn't require that you do anything, unless you are a marriage officiant, so I don't see how you can refuse to obey the decision.
